title: Fractions: Understanding Parts of a Whole

vocab.definition: A number that shows part of a whole
The top number of a fraction
The bottom number of a fraction
Different fractions that name the same amount
To write a fraction in simplest form

teachingNotes: Use visual models (fraction bars, circles). Emphasize numerator/denominator roles, equivalence, and unit fractions.

sample.question: What fraction is half of a pizza?
How many fourths make a whole?
What fraction is shaded if 3 of 5 parts are colored?

truefalse.question: 1/2 means one out of two equal parts.
The bottom number is the numerator.
Fractions show parts of a whole.
The numerator tells how many parts we have.

fillintheblank.question: The top number of a fraction is the ___
To compare fractions, they need the same ___

shortanswer.question: What does the numerator tell us?
What does the denominator tell us?
How do you know if fractions are equivalent?
Give three examples of 1/2 in real life.
How do you add fractions with same denominator?

wordProblems.question: A pizza cut into 8 slices. Tom ate 3 slices. What fraction?
12 eggs in a carton. 4 are used. What fraction remains?
A cake divided into 6 pieces. 2 eaten. What fraction left?
30 students. 1/3 wear glasses. How many wear glasses?
24 hours in a day. What fraction is 6 hours?
A jar has 20 marbles. 1/4 are red. How many red marbles?
15 questions on a test. Sarah got 3/5 correct. How many correct?
